result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patricio Ivan Carranza

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Patricio Ivan Carranza in court.  Attorney William Hotchkiss for Michael V Fuentes in court for Patricio Ivan Carranza.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Defendant in compliance with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement. Court orders defendant make a minimum of $100.00 per month towards restitution. Case adjourned for another Review Hearing, Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and Filed, Amended Plea Agreement

Defendant Patricio Ivan Carranza in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing. On State's motion Count 1 is amended to disorderly conduct. State to file an amended complaint.
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed. Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 21.
COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered count dismissed.

Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 310 of the Safety Building.  Review hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Patricio Ivan Carranza in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Due to the lateness of the hour, Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement, received and filed.

Defendant Patricio Ivan Carranza in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patricio Ivan Carranza appeared by video means with Attorney. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Patricio Ivan Carranza in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has completed indigency paperwork.  Based on the information provided court instructed him to try to re-qualify for SPD representation.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Patricio Ivan Carranza in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for pre-trial confernce. 
Defendant advised the Court he has been unsuccessful in retaining private counsel and requests an indigency hearing. 
Coutr orders matter adjourned back to Br. 37.  Indigency hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with G.P-R. or the victims residence.

Defendant Patricio Ivan Carranza in court.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/18/22 @ 2:30p
